column4: How can I troubleshoot Ubuntu bootup problems?  Is there a "repair" disk?
you can use an ubuntu install live cd as a repair disc
it won't boot from the disc
any idea why (BIOS boots first from flash, then cd then hdd)
and it wont boot from a cd disc?
no...  never gets to the "boot from cd" part...  just DMI update... and "GRUB" and nothing
weird part, this has happened on three separate computers, from different hardware
I don't see how a kvm switch could muck up an mbr AND cause it to not boot from cd or flash...???
i would press f2 f11 f8 and f5 during boot to get to the bios menu and try to find something
if it is getting to grub then the bios has already booted from the hard disk so you know your boot order is messed up somehow
yeah, I suppose it's worth a shot, as I said before, it's like the computers go through an existential crisis for a few days, cause eventually, they will boot from cd or flash
right now it's like hot potato...  some will work others won't...  wonder if maybe my meager apartment isn't supplying adequate power?
i dont know. i really dont know anything about hardware. and my knowledge of bios's is just from installing ubuntu and a general knowledge of what they do
I troubleshot this thoroughly on the oldest of the comps, thinking it was bad, but I took out CMOS battery, also cleared CMOS by shorting the pins...  no luck, then one day it worked
i dont think that was me lol :P
actually you might need tar -xzf for a gzipped tar file
